title: Rajkummar Rao Recalls How People Initially Were Not Sure If He Was Cut Out For Lead Roles

Rajkummar Rao Recalls How People Initially Were Not Sure If He Was Cut Out For Lead Roles

Rajkummar Rao Recalls How People Initially Were Not Sure If He Was Cut Out For Lead Roles

He played a side-kick in a film that made Kangana Ranaut the 'Queen' of Bollywood. Rajkummar Rao played a small role but it was enough to make filmmakers bet their money on him.

Today, he boasts of back to back mega-hits and films that have changed the way we look at Cinema. From a critically acclaimed Shahid to a box-office hit like Stree, Rajkummar Rao set his own rules and broke barriers! Currently, he's busy promoting his upcoming film Made in China.

Was it always easy for him to break the clutter and establish a firm foot in the industry where everyday new faces enter Mumbai to chase their dreams. Well, certainly not! Nothing guarantees success in the first go and in an industry as dynamic as Bollywood, everything changes every second.

Rao believes that success changes people's perception and the way they look at you. He added that people initially thought he wasn't cutout to play lead roles. Thankfully, things have changed now. Talking to TOI, he said,

"Success changes people’s perception of you and the way they look at you. People have cast aspersions on many actors because they didn’t look conventional. But, these actors proved them wrong and the same people started praising them. This has happened with me as well. Initially, some people thought that I wasn’t cut out for lead roles, but today, they think differently. From then to now, it’s been an exciting ride. I am happy with my career graph, and the way cinema is shifting shapes and people are coming up with great ideas and stories, which are being lapped up by the audience. It’s a great sign for us."

The film has been helmed by National Award-winner Mikhil Musale, who won the best director for his 2016 drama-thriller 'Wrong Side Raju'. Dinesh Vijan is producing the flick.'Made in China', originally scheduled to hit the big screens on August 15, will now be releasing on Diwali this year.
